Great Sandy!

Here are my answers:

How old are you:
I am 42 years old. I can remember watching Transformers in High
School, rushing home to watch it along with Robotech - my two favorite
cartoons, and probably what shaped my cartoon Scifi :) (I did like
Voltron and Battle of the planets too btw)

Which types of transformer are you most familiar?
I am mostly familiar with the G1/G2 80's cartoon as well as the US
comic. I also know Beast Wars, Beast Machines, TF: Antimated and TF:
Prime.

What are your favorite characters from the cartoons?
From the cartoon, Soundwave, Cyclonus and Scourge. My all time
favorite though is Shockwave but from the comics that came out in the
80-90's. I loved Shockwave's logic and intelligence, and turning into
a big gun wasn't bad either. He was an evil Mr Spock and I loved that
personality style and he well represents my logical side. Cyclonus is
loyalty, honor and duty which I like as well and I believe is a big
part of my personality. Scourge is aggression but he is also a hunter
and a goal orientated person who wants what he wants. I like that
sometimes.

How long have you been roleplaying, and where?
Well lets see. I have been roleplaying since the mid 80's. I have
played a great many different types of RPG's from D&D to Star
Frontiers, Star Trek, various types of super hero games, we had even
made up a table top version of Transformers which was cool. I have
been playing on a MUSH/MUX site in the mid to late 90's, although
nothing recently. (MUSH/MUX are like big chat rooms where you can
roleplay in real time.) I have played in games like this one, via
email, since 2000 or something like that, but the transformers
versions of it I started I think in 2003 or there about.

What do you like about Role playing, what are you looking for?
I like them for relaxations. For me it is like a reading a book only I
am writing it in collaboration with other writers. Battles are cool,
but the epic drama, the story lines, the personal growth, THAT is what
keeps me going. But most importantly I like having FUN!

- Preston

On 11/13/11, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> Okay, this looks fun actually.  For starters, I'm forty one years old, and
> I'm familiar with TFG1, Armada, Energon, Cybertron, Beast Wars, Beast
> machines and TF animated.
>
> I've been role playing for about five to six years and I would have to say
> that one of my favorite characters from Armada is DEMOLISHER. He was
> considered the comic relief of the series.  In TF animated, I would have to
> say that my favorite was basically all of them, with the exception of
> Starscream being my ultimate favorite.  No matter what series, Starscream
> was the best. Especially in the Energon series, where he actually had a
> change of heart.
>
> What I like about role playing is that we can take on whatever character we
> want, within reason. I chose my characters based on my many aspects of my
> personality, and found it fun to break it up into various characters.
> Tucson represents my short temper while Nightshift portrays my reasonable
> side.  Then there's the casually comical side portrayed by Quickstride and
> Uproar.  Sarcasm gets portrayed by Rattrap and Straight Shot.  Put them all
> together and you have me.
>
>
>
> Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already
> posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.
>
> On Nov 13, 2011, at 9:16 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
>> Here are a few questions that i asked Airly, and I think I will throw
>> out in a public way. You don't have to answer them all if you don't
>> want to, some of us are private people, but they can give us a little
>> background into who we are as players and what we like.
>>
>> How old are you (You don't have to answer this one if you don't want to.
>> Heh!)
>>
>> Which types of transformer are you most familiar? (80's Cartoon, 80's
>> Comic book, TF: Antimated, TF: Prime, TF: Energon, Dreamwave Comics,
>> ect.)
>>
>> What are your favorite characters from the cartoons?
>>
>> How long have you been roleplaying, and where?
>>
>> What do you like about Role playing, what are you looking for?
>>
>> Again, you don't have to answer all the questions, but it gives
>> something to think about, and helps us to get to know you. I will be
>> posting my own answers as well in the next day or so :)
>>
>> - Preston
>>
